file_content.text: Extorter.
The material things themselves aren't that important, but... it's like you gave us back more than that.
Leisha! Vidas! Everybody, they're back!
Leisha! Vidas! Everybody, he's back!
Leisha! Vidas! Everybody, she's back!
Is everything okay? What did the scavengers take?
Okay, calm down, people. Let's deal with the possessions first so those who want to can leave.
Hopefully, this will help you start over.
I found everything.
We can only hope. Now... what do we have?
Here you are. No charge.
This is fabulous. Not a page lost.
Yeah. I can't wait to turn this on.
I have to show these to my mother. She's been so worried... be right back!
I think what she meant to say was "thank you," but... she's a little giddy. Don't worry. None of us will forget your generosity.
My life has value, and I risked it. What have you got in return?
I'll need compensation.
Are you serious? You saw we were beaten down and came to take whatever we had left?
I'm out, then. Someone stole my credit chip, I've got nothing.
I've got credits, but just enough for me.
Urana, it's alright, I've got some credits. I'll cover it. It's going to be okay.
Here. Just give us what you found and get out.
I told my mother about you going to our settlement. She wished you luck.
Sorry! The camp's full, no room, no nothing. Wait. You're not refugees. Why are you here?
It's a free planet, isn't it?
I can go where I want.
Not for us.
You seem disturbed.
Hey! Did the Republic send you? Can we get out of this stinking refugee camp and go home?
I'm not part of the local units. What's this about your homes?
Sorry, wrong soldier.
You haven't heard? Scavenger crews attacked us. The local troops are fighting them, but they forced us to evacuate.
Who are you?
I'm Urana, Urana Kiel. I guess you're not part of the local forces.
Hey. You're not a refugee and you're not an aid worker. Why are you here?
I'm a Jedi, I go where I'm needed.
I am here to help.
Well, we needed you a week ago. First the scavengers attacked us, then the local troops forced us out of our homes.
I go where there's opportunity.
Just exploring the planet.
Then turn around.
Is Taris at war?
Refugees? On Taris?
Might as well be.
The local troops dragged us out of our homes. They said we'd be safer here while they fight the scavengers and pirates.
"Spill," yourself.
Name's Urana, Urana Kiel. See, people with no reason to be here are usually thieves. But I'm not getting thief vibes from you.
If you're looking for... well, anything, you won't find it here. Scavengers have our homes, and the army's fighting them.
While one side's looting, the other's bombing. And we get to sit in a tent and hope.
It's better to move you here than leave you on a battlefield.
Those troops saved your life.
They didn't have to drag us out in the middle of the night like they did. They could have let us grab a few things.
My mom's in shock--barely leaves our tent.
Are you okay?
It's not me I'm worried about. It's my brother, it's my mom who hasn't left her tent.
So I'm trying to keep us together and stay honest. Some people around here... I'm not going to do what they do for credits.
Too much information, thanks.
What else am I going to do? Got no job. No house. My mom's practically catatonic.
The whole camp's just waiting to go back to the settlement, but the scavengers are still there, probably looting left and right.
I could check out your home, see if it's still standing.
I could find out.
What can I do?
Seriously? Well, if you could get back there, we left a lot of things behind--
Hey! Did you say you're going to her house?
Someone's going to the settlement? Get me my landspeeder!
My farming droids are still out there! Oh, and my sonic washer. Hey! Bada! Get out here, someone's making a trip!
All of you, back off! We do this one at a time, or nobody gets anything!
This, uh... this could take a while. Are you still in?
Just--everyone can't talk at once.
Sure, just keep it orderly.
Okay. One at a time. You get one item--one portable item. Make it count.
A favor is one thing. If I'm ransacking a war zone, I'll need to be paid.
I'll need to start charging.
That's fair, but you get payment after, not before. Get to our houses and bring back... well, Leisha, you start.
I want my digging tools. I don't know how long we'll be here, and if we're going to build or grow anything, we'll need them.
All I hear all day is dumb boys fighting 'cause there's nothing to do. I've got a box with ten custom pazaak decks. Bring those.
I got a micro-generator in my toolbox. Bring the toolbox and we can plug in everything electric.
I've spent years working on a novel in my spare time. It's on datafile. I'm sure it won't have been stolen.
And what I need is our nadu seeds. Just a few packets would go a long way. It'd mean everything to my mother. Please... hurry.
Do not draw comfort from material possessions. Draw it from one another.
This is greed. [Refuse quest]
Sorry, I meant to provide a sympathetic ear, not a shipping company.
No. [Refuse quest]
Great, guys. Thanks for ruining it for everyone.
Sounds horrendous, but the important thing is, don't give up.
That's rough. [Leave]
I won't. I don't have a choice.
Quit eyeing my stuff.
